edu.northwestern.at.utils
Class UTF8Properties

java.lang.Object
  java.util.Dictionary<K,V>
      java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.Object,java.lang.Object>
          java.util.Properties
              edu.northwestern.at.utils.UTF8Properties
All Implemented Interfaces:
TaggedStrings, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.util.Map<java.lang.Object,java.lang.Object>
public class UTF8Properties
extends java.util.Properties
implements TaggedStrings

UTF8Properties -- A UTF8 compatible version of Java Properties.

Regular Java Properties must be read and written using the ISO8859-1 character encoding. UTF8Properties reads and writes the properties using the utf-8 character encoding instead.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Method Detail

load

public void load(java.io.InputStream inputStream,
                 java.lang.String defaultValue)
          throws java.io.IOException
Reads a property list (key and element pairs) from a utf-8 encoded input stream.

Parameters:
inputStream - The input stream.
defaultValue - The default value when none specified.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - When an error occurs while reading from the input stream.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - When the input stream contains an invalid Unicode escape sequence.

The default value is assigned to any key which does not have a value. Assume the default value is the string "missing". Then the input line

x=1

returns a key of "x" with value of "1", while the input line

x

returns a key of "x" with value of "missing" .

load

public void load(java.io.InputStream inputStream)
          throws java.io.IOException
Reads a property list (key and element pairs) from a utf-8 encoded input stream.

Overrides:
load in class java.util.Properties
Parameters:
inputStream - The input stream.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - When an error occurs while reading from the input stream.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - When the input stream contains an invalid Unicode escape sequence.

Null is used as the default value for any key without a specified value.

isContinued

protected boolean isContinued(java.lang.String line)
Check if property continues on the next line.

Parameters:
line - Beginning of the property that might be continued on the next line.
Returns:
true if property continues on the following line.

A trailing "\" character indicates a property value is continued on the next line.
